answers.answer: HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you are pregnant and having all these symptoms, rule out parathyroid disorders, electrolyte imbalance, anemia, low calcium and Vit D3, and diabetes (with fasting high, go for glucose tolerance test). Please consult an endocrine specialist.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: i am a 25 yr old female and over the last 2 yrs or so have had seemingly unrelated symptoms.  sometimes ill have tingeling in my fingers and toes that last a couple of weeks and then gose away. ive been having blurry vison and pain in the top of 1 of my eyeballs and decreased night vison, ive always had bad vison but this is all new. ive seen 4 or 5 eye dr and been told i have something diffrent from each one. sometimes im extremly fatiuged, sometimes my balance isnt like normal, sometimes my memory just dosnt seem to wk right. my dr suspected ms although i had a clear mri. he refferd me to a nuero opthamologist to see if i had optic nuritis and he said i did not. im now seein a cardiologist and EP dr because of heart palpatations. i wore a 48 hr holter moniter and it showed and avg resting rate of 92 with 22 atrial premature beats pr hr  2 runs of supraventicular tachycardia at 160bpm and a run of wide complex irregular tachycardia. but i had a normal echo.  i have slightly high fasting blood sugar of usually around 115. cholesteral is good thyroid is normal. i am currently 6 mo pregnat with my 4th child. could all this be related or r they all just seperate things. any information or coments on any of this would be very helpful to me. thanks for taking the time to read my story
title: could i have ms
